intro: Erysimum curvipes, commonly known as the bentstem wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Erysimum curvipes thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
